block.p: Re ''Prescription for Failure,'' by Paul Krugman (column, July 26):

The only way to provide affordable prescription drug coverage for all is to pool the burden as widely as possible in a single-payer health care system that provides universal coverage. The for-profit insurance industry has no motive to cover the sickest people because it makes no business sense.
Re ''Prescription for Failure,'' by Paul Krugman (column, July 26):

The only way to provide affordable prescription drug coverage for all is to pool the burden as widely as possible in a single-payer health care system that provides universal coverage. The for-profit insurance industry has no motive to cover the sickest people because it makes no business sense.

Unfortunately, any real discussion of universal coverage is stifled by the for-profit health care industry and its lobbyists. Forty-four million Americans have no insurance at all. Health care financing must change, but don't expect the Republicans or the Democrats to lead the way.
GERALD GOLLIN, M.D. Redlands, Calif., July 26, 2000
